    • Method Detail

      • split

        public static PercentagesUtil.SplitResult split(java.math.BigDecimal sum,
                                                int n,
                                                int scale)
        Splits sum into n parts such that sum of all parts is equal to the original sum.

        For example splitting 100 with scale 2 in 3 parts will result in: 33.33, 33.33 and 33.34.

        Parameters:
        sum - the amount to be split
        n - number of parts to split into
        scale - the number of fractional digits to use for each part
        Returns:
        split result can be used to find out value of each part
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - when scale of the sum is greater than the scale for the requested parts when n is 0 or negative when sum is negative or greater than 100

      • closestTo

        public static java.math.BigDecimal closestTo(float val,
                                             int scale)
        Returns a BigDecimal with a specific scale that is closest to specified float value.

        This is needed because percentages in AmpActivityProgram are mapped with float type. Can remove this code once percentages are migrated to BigDecimal as well.

        Parameters:
        val - float value
        scale - number of decimal digits in the fractional part for the returned BigDecimal
        Returns:
        float value converted to BigDecimal with the specified scale
